intro: Tinantia lancifolia, commonly known as the sharp-leaved arrowroot, is a herbaceous plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Cyclanthaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically yellow or greenish in color. Its rhizomes are used in traditional medicine and as a source of starchy food. Tinantia lancifolia thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories.
